_header: When I went beyond the sea
_description: Fare Far and Have Little — five quatrains and burden: ‘Hos is to hoth at hom / Ryd out it wol agon’

CamGon383.First Lines:
Wan ic wente byȝonde þe seeryche man for te
                    bee…
CamGon383.Last Lines:
…& his halwe [ ]ereȝyf vs grace wel to
                    don
CamGon383.Note:
Before the burden is written ‘alone y lyue alone’,
                    apparently the name of the air: cf. 452, 3701.
CamGon383.Editions:
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 280; 1977, 247-8.
Greene,  Richard Leighton,
                        ed.  
             A Selection of English Carols.
Clarendon Medieval and Tudor Series.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1962: 146.
